SEARCH
Package acsse.csc3a.graph

Interface Graph<V,E>

Type Parameters:
V - the tye which the vertex stores
E - the type which the edge stores
All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AdjacencyMapGraph
public interface Graph<V,E> extends Serializable
An interface that stipulates functionality a graph must realize

    Creates and returns a new Edge from vertex u to vertex v, storing element x; an error occurs if there already exists an edge from u to v.

      Returns an iteration of all the edges of the graph
      Returns:

    • degree

      int degree(Vertex<V> v)
      Returns the number of edges from vertex v
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex being queried
      Returns:
      returns the number of edges for a specific for a specific vertex

    • allEdges

      Iterable<Edge<E>> allEdges(Vertex<V> v)
      Returns the all edges from vertex v
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex being queried
      Returns:
      returns an iterable collection of edges for a specific vertex

    • getEdge

      Edge<E> getEdge(Vertex<V> u, Vertex<V> v)
      Returns the edge from vertex u to vertex v, if one exists; otherwise return null. For an undirected graph, there is no difference between getEdge(u, v) and getEdge(v, u).
      Parameters:
      u - the first vertex at one end of the edge
      v - the vertex at the other end of the edge
      Returns:
      returns the edge from u to v if they are adjacent

    • endVertices

      Vertex<V>[] endVertices(Edge<E> e)
      Returns an array containing the two end point vertices of edge e. If the graph is directed, the first vertex is the origin and the second is the destination.
      Parameters:
      e - the edge being queried
      Returns:
      return the vertices of edge e as an array of length two

    • opposite

      Vertex<V> opposite(Vertex<V> v, Edge<E> e)
      For edge e incident to vertex v, returns the other vertex of the edge; an error occurs if e is not incident to v.
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex being queried
      e - the edge being queried
      Returns:
      returns the vertex that is opposite vertex v on edge

    • insertVertex

      Vertex<V> insertVertex(V element)
      Creates and returns a new Vertex storing element x.
      Parameters:
      element - the element being added
      Returns:
      the resulting vertex created to hold the element

    • insertEdge

      Edge<E> insertEdge(Vertex<V> u, Vertex<V> v, E element) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates and returns a new Edge from vertex u to vertex v, storing element x; an error occurs if there already exists an edge from u to v.
      Parameters:
      u - the first vertex
      v - the second vertex
      element - the element being added within the edge
      Returns:
      the resulting edge created to hold the element
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • removeVertex

      void removeVertex(Vertex<V> v)
      Removes vertex v and all its incident edges from the graph.
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex being removed

    • removeEdge

      void removeEdge(Edge<E> e)
      Removes edge e from the graph.
      Parameters:
      e - the edge being removed
